results.name: n repeated 2^(n-1) times, see formulas.
comment: It appears that a(n)=sum{k=0..n-1, (1-(-1)^A000108(k))/2}. Compare with A083058. - _Paul Barry_, Mar 31 2008
formula: a(n)=A070939(n) if n>0. - _R. J. Mathar_, Aug 13 2008
a(n) = A029837(n+1) = 1 + floor(log_2(n)) if n>0. - _Michael Somos_, Jun 02 2019
mathematica: Two versions: with recurrence relation, a[1] = 1; a[n_]:= a[n] = a[Floor[n/2]] + 1; Table[a[n], {n, 200}] or with explicit formula, Table[Floor[Log[2, 2n]], {n, 100}]
a[ n_] := If[ n < 1, 0, BitLength[n]]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jun 02 2019 *)
